newsitem.title: KUWAIT: New Kuwaiti government to have majority in house.
newsitem.headline: New Kuwaiti government to have majority in house.

text.p: Kuwait's Emir Sheikh Jaber al-Ahmad al-Sabah on Tuesday accepted the government's resignation after parliamentary elections on Monday in which opposition deputies lost their majority in the house.
An official statement read on state radio said the emir accepted the resignation, in line with the constitution.
The emir has not yet said who would head the new government but Crown Prince Sheikh Saad al-Abdulla al-Sabah is widely expected to once again form and head the next cabinet, analysts said.
An emiri decree invited the new parliament to hold its first session on October 20.
Election results for 50 seats showed that pro-government candidates emerged as the main winners in Monday's vote, enabling the next cabinet to muster a majority in the house.
The outgoing house was dominated by opposition politicians who opened wide probes into alleged official corruption and kept a close eye on state spending.
